dataIdInfo.idAbs: CAD files store geographic data by geometry. For every discrete geometry; points, lines or polygons. What ArcGIS typically differentiates into different and distinct feature classes, CAD differentiates using unique values in a field named Layers. This tool combs all three feature classes, collects all layer names and lets the user (you) select one to export to a target geodatabase.

tool.name: ExportLayer

param.name: input_cad
param.dialogReference: This is the input CAD file with a DWG extenstion. The toll is set up to only recognize files with a DWG extension.

param.name: cad_layer
param.dialogReference: This field will become active and provide a list of available layers once the CAD (*.dwg) file has been specified. Once active, select from a list of avialable layers to export.

param.name: output_gdb
param.dialogReference: This is where you are planning on storing the new feature class created from the speicified layer.

tool.summary: CAD files store geographic data by geometry. For every discrete geometry; points, lines or polygons. What ArcGIS typically differentiates into different and distinct feature classes, CAD differentiates using unique values in a field named Layers. This tool combs all three feature classes, collects all layer names and lets the user (you) select one to export to a target geodatabase.
